alert.note: Alert for Natrona (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 12:28AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Natrona. * WHEN...Until 215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1227 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is possible along US Highway 20/26 near Natrona. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Along US Highway 20/26 near Natrona is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goldeneye Reservoir and Natrona. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
